about_the_game:
Eulogy of an Insect is a hand-drawn role playing game with twisting dungeons, otherworldly locales, and secrets galore. Play as Charlie, a young woman searching for her long lost father. She makes an ill-fated turn and finds herself in a world devoid of the familiar—a place caught in the oppressive grip of a figure known only as the Imperatix. On this journey you'll encounter layered dungeons, at times engaging the player with minigames that break up the action with new temporary styles of gameplay. Overcome all of these hurdles, and this abject world just might become a dubiously better place in Charlie's wake.

Features

  • Traverse twisted dungeons strewn with puzzles, paths layering back into themselves, minigames, and unusual scenarios
  • Engage nefarious foes in turn-based combat. Make use of the power of Woven to burn your targets to a crisp, freeze them into giant popsicles, or squirt ink onto them. Successfully target an enemy's weakness and regain lost HP as a bonus!
  • Use each of the 12 playable characters' unique attack styles to your advantage. Transform mid-battle, vomit on foes, manually line up quick shots, and more
  • Befriend these characters to unlock their own personal quests, eking out more of this world and their stories within
  • Break up the RPG action with short segments featuring shoot 'em ups, the very necessary fishing minigame, and much more
  • Hand-drawn art illustrating an all-you-can-see buffet of locales, from a pagoda-turned-shopping mall to a giant frozen corpse inhabited by gangster maggots
  • An original soundtrack by Chuck Salamone (Hylics 2, Flips¿de), featuring over 30 unique songs
  • Unweave a grand conspiracy in a rich story filled with humor
  • Absorb useless(?) information. Did you know that fear of the number 13 is known as triskaidekaphobia?

content_descriptors.notes: Eulogy of an Insect depicts a moderate amount of profanity, and cartoon violence is a common sight, but specific moments in the game depict blood and violence in an unrealistic and stylized manner. Alcohol and tobacco use are implied in the game, including a playable character always seen holding a smokeless cigar.

She makes an ill-fated turn and finds herself in a world devoid of the familiar—a place caught in the oppressive grip of a figure known only as the Imperatix.   • Unweave a grand conspiracy in a rich story filled with humor
  • Absorb useless(?) information. Did you know that fear of the number 13 is known as triskaidekaphobia?

movies.name: Eulogy of an Insect Official Trailer

name: Eulogy of an Insect
short_description: A skullcap-wearing woman makes a woefully wrong turn, ending up in a crapsack world full of fantastical creatures. Among them she finds misery, BUGS, apathy, and a shockingly strict adherence to paying one's fair share in taxes.
